intro: Cerastium peplidifolium, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear cress, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many edible and economically important plants. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming in early spring. Its leaves are characterized by their rounded, succulent shape and are often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. Cerastium peplidifolium thrives in rocky or alpine environments, where it forms dense mats and plays a role in stabilizing soil in harsh conditions.
